name: Diversion; reconsignment; change of instructions
text:
§490:7-303    (1)  Unless the bill of lading otherwise provides, the carrier may deliver the goods to a person or destination other than that stated in the bill or may otherwise dispose of the goods on instructions from



	(a)	The holder of a negotiable bill; or
	(b)	The consignor on a nonnegotiable bill notwithstanding contrary instructions from the consignee; or
	(c)	The consignee on a nonnegotiable bill in the absence of contrary instructions from the consignor, if the goods have arrived at the billed destination or if the consignee is in possession of the bill; or
	(d)	The consignee on a nonnegotiable bill if he is entitled as against the consignor to dispose of them.



	(2)  Unless such instructions are noted on a negotiable bill of lading, a person to whom the bill is duly negotiated can hold the bailee according to the original terms. [L 1965, c 208, §7-303; HRS §490:7-303]
